intro: Hieracium flagellariforme subsp. jaromirense, commonly known as the Jaromir's goatweed, is a flowering plant species native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It has slender, hairy stems and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its subspecific name honors the botanist Jaromir, reflecting its significance in botanical studies.
